title: [Large-scale] Advanced Analog Electronics Course via Hybrid Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electronics theory (Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Law) and ability to interpret simple circuits
context.additional_context: Integration of Virtual Experimentation Environments and Real-Time Collaboration Tools Using Digital Devices

learning_goals: They can design basic amplifier circuits using analog circuit simulation tools (e.g., LTspice) and write performance analysis reports.
In hybrid learning models, over 80% participation rate is achieved in online discussions and pre-learning materials.
In 3-person teams, learners prototype and evaluate filter circuits applicable to real communication systems.
They quantitatively explain the correlation between circuit parameters and performance metrics (e.g., gain, bandwidth, SNR) through experimental data analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
